subject: Re: [junit] Junit4 @After method not called after my test timeout
msgSnippet: Qian, Are you using JUnit 4.3.1?  If so, please log a bug on SourceForge, and we ll get to it as quick as we can.  Thanks, David Saff
messageBody:
Qian,

Are you using JUnit 4.3.1? If so, please log a bug on SourceForge,
and we'll get to it as quick as we can. Thanks,

David Saff

On 6/27/07, Qian Wang <jane6210@...> wrote:
> Hi,
> I have a question regarding the timeout
> exception. whenever my test throw timeout exception,
> it will not execute the @After method I specified. Any
> idea on this?
> Here's the src code.
>
> thanks
>
>
> ====================================================
>
> import static org.junit.Assert.*;
>
> import java.sql.Connection;
> import java.sql.Date;
> import java.sql.SQLException;
>
> import java.sql.Timestamp;
> import java.util.Iterator;
> import java.util.List;
> import java.util.Map;
>
> import org.junit.After;
> import org.junit.AfterClass;
> import org.junit.Before;
> import org.junit.BeforeClass;
> import org.junit.Test;
> /*qianwang
> Jun 26, 2007
> */
> public class QianTest {
> @BeforeClass
> public static void beforeClass(){
> System.out.println("beforeClass");
> }
> @AfterClass
> public static void afterClass(){
> System.out.println("afterclass");
> }
> @Before
> public void before(){
> System.out.println("before");
> }
> @After
> public void after(){
> System.out.println("after");
> }
> @Test(timeout = 2)
> public void testA(){
> try{
> while(getNumber() != 1);
> assertEquals(1, 1);
> }catch(Exception ex){
> if(ex.getMessage().startsWith("test timed out"))
> System.out.println("damn");
> }
>
> System.out.println("test");
> }
> public int getNumber(){
> return 2;
> }
>
> }
>
